intro: Swainsona gracilis, commonly known as the slender swainsona, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often blooming in the summer months. Swainsona gracilis is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, pod-like fruits that split open when mature to release the seeds.
